definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: The maximum elevation of 650 meters or more, is that the so-called pampas area.

sentences.english: The one metre border should be in a different colour from the rest of the matted area.
sentences.chinese: 比賽場邊界內一公尺，鋪上不同顏色的墊子。

sentences.english: Abstract—This paper deals with the practical application of the newly developed stochastic watt-hour meter.
sentences.chinese: 這紙處理嶄新發展的隨機程序瓦時公尺的實際申請。

sentences.english: He turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
sentences.chinese: 他又量了北面，按著測量竿計算，共長二百五十公尺。

sentences.english: The two 2000-meter mountains are selling for US$175,000.
sentences.chinese: 這兩座高2000公尺的山要賣美金十七萬五千美金。

sentences.english: About 2 meters height, we are tring to figure out how to use Low Head generator with terraced field. Crazy, right?

sentences.english: We measure the space in cubic meters.

sentences.english: The mountain yellow soil is distributed at 900 m high mountainous region.
sentences.chinese: 在900公尺以上的山地，尚有山地黃壤的分佈。

sentences.english: The ice worm in this picture was found underneath 3.6m of snow.
sentences.chinese: 照片裏的這隻冰蟲是在雪地下三點六公尺被發現的。

sentences.english: It was sealed by a wall and contained chalky soil to the depth of one metre.
sentences.chinese: 它被一堵牆密封著，仿如白堊時期的泥土深達一公尺。

sentences.english: You gotta get up to 2,600 meters high.

sentences.english: Now, our factory floor is about 5,000 square meters.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我們的工廠佔地約5，000平方公尺。
